column2: d
$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ is a current/flow/river of/in $x_{2}$ flowing in direction to/towards $x_{3}$ from direction/source $x_{4}$.
column3: [$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); $x_1$ flushes toward $x_3$; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ fails at doing $x_{2}$ (state/event); $x_{1}$ is a failure at its role in $x_{2}$.
column3: Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also $x_2$ ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of $x_1$.  See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the face [head/body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is facial.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
column3: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

column2: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column3: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
column3: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
column3: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
column3: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
column3: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
column3: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column3: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column3: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column3: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column3: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column3: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column3: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column3: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column3: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column3: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
column3: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column3: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column3: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column3: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column3: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column3: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
column3: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a } - attentive
{a'a cu'i} - inattentive
{a'a nai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a } - attentive
{a'a cu'i} - inattentive
{a'a nai} - avoiding.
$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}).  See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
column3: Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases.  See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.
column3: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}).  See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume.  See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
column3: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks.  See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a fool.
$x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons $x_{2}$ directed/led by $x_{3}$ organized for purpose $x_{4}$.
column3: ($x_1$ is a mass; $x_2$ is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; $x_3$ conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}).  See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_{2}$ to receiver $x_{3}$ from transmitter/origin $x_{4}$ via means/medium $x_{5}$.
column3: [also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied]; [$x_5$ carrier]; (cf. {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}).

column2: $x_{1}$ is a son of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$ [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brain [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].
$x_{1}$ is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: midsection].
column3: Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}).  See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ over path $x_{5}$; $x_{1}$ is a carrier/[porter].
column3: Alienation from $x_2$ to $x_3$ is implied.  See also {marce}, {muvdu}, {benji}, {klama}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ whips/lashes/snaps [a sudden violent motion].
$x_{1}$ is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be $x_{2}$ in/by standard/agreement $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ must do $x_{2}$.
column3: Also $x_3$ frame of reference.  See also {zifre}, {fuzme}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_{2}$ from disease $x_{3}$.
interval event contour: in the aftermath of ...; since ...; retrospective/perfect              |     |----.

discursive: 
{ba'u} - exaggeration
{ba'ucu'i} - accuracy
{ba'unai} - understatement.

sumti link to attach sumti (default $x_{2}$) to a selbri; used in descriptions.
location tense relation/direction; north of.
vocative: request to send/speak.
{benji} modal, 1st place (sender)                   sent by ...
separates multiple linked sumti within a selbri; used in descriptions.
elidable terminator: end linked sumti in specified description.

{be'u} - lack/need
{be'ucu'i} - presence/satisfaction
{be'unai} - satiation.
digit/number: 8 (digit) [eight].
prefixed to a mex operator to indicate high priority.
non-logical interval connective: unordered between ... and ...
convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
sumti place tag: tag 4th sumti place.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #6 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #7 (specified by goi).
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
attitudinal: \n{i'u} - familiarity\n{i'unai} - mystery.

{iucu'i} - no love lost
{iunai} - hatred.

bridi logical affirmer; scope is an entire bridi.

column3: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
vocative: \n{ki'e} - thanks\n{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.

pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.

elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.

letteral for k.

discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
digit/number: less than.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
column3: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

column2: the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
$x_1$ is an omnibus for carrying $x_2$ in medium $x_3$ propelled by $x_4$.
column3: Cf. {sorprekarce}; {pavloibasfa} for single-decker, {relyloibasfa} for double-decker {jonbasfa} for articulated, {clajonbasfa} for bi-articulated, {dizbasfa} for low-floor, {drucaubasfa} for open top, {kumbasfa} for coach, {dicybasfa} for trolleybus.

column2: $x_1$ will happen in $x_2$ length of time; $x_1$ will happen $x_2$ length of time after $x_3$
$x_1$ is the 'back', dorsum of body $x_2$
column3: Opposite of ventral part of the body. Not necessarily should be a posterior part of the body. Determined by bilateral symmetry of the body. See also {vente}, {trixe}, {cutne}.

column2: $x_1$ is the "beneficiary"/intended-recipient of $x_2$ (event/action), as intended by $x_3$ // $x_2$ is done for $x_1$
column3: A "beneficiary" here is someone or something for which something is done, and this relation may be either beneficial or disadvantageous. Consider "I poisoned the cake for him" vs "I baked a cake for him" ("for him to eat" would be a purpose/goal). See also {be'ei}, {kosmu}, {terzu'e}, {selxau}

column2: $x_1$ pertains to bear goo metaphysics in aspect $x_2$

$x_1$ dons metaphorical asbestos suit $x_2$ to guard against flames $x_3$ on topic $x_4$ from $x_5$, who disagrees with post $x_6$ for reason $x_7$, not realizing that the post was meant to be sent to $x_8$ rather than all of mailing list $x_9$ (default jboste) where it was posted in response to email  $x_{10}$, whose author wishes selma'o  $x_{11}$ (default SE) were extended to concisely express place  $x_{12}$ of brivla  $x_{13}$ (default besto) which has place structure  $x_{14}$ and too many places because of sadistic whim  $x_{15}$ of brivla-maker  $x_{16}$, who also created brivla  $x_{17}$ which has place structure  $x_{18}$, and so winds up using too many of cmavo  $x_{19}$ (default zi'o) in order to make the brivla ( $x_{13}$) more usable by standard  $x_{20}$ and wishes they had never heard of the word besto for reason  $x_{21}$, not realizing for reason  $x_{22}$ that it was suggested sarcastically due to boredom  $x_{23}$ of person  $x_{24}$, who is proposing it against better judgement  $x_{25}$ because it is fun by standard  $x_{26}$, but still wishes it had as many places as  $x_{27}$ (default du) for reason  $x_{28}$, and feels like throwing in epistemology sumti  $x_{29}$, because he/she knows both that gismu  $x_{30}$ (default besto) has its place structure defined by run-on sentence  $x_{31}$ and that epistemology sumti are used in gismu  $x_{32}$ by epistemology  $x_{33}$, notwithstanding the fact that  $x_{34}$ actually has a use for besto places  $x_{35}$ (default 1) through  $x_{36}$ (default $x_7$) and wishes this weren't an extremely long and stupid joke, longer than joke  $x_{37}$ and stupider than joke  $x_{38}$ but still appreciated by  $x_{39}$ - a fact which says  $x_{40}$ about them in the opinion of  $x_{41}$ - but not seen as even remotely amusing by  $x_{42}$, who is aware that  $x_{43}$ has a use for the gismu besto because of  $x_{45}$
column3: A joke gismu from http://mw.lojban.org/papri/besto . Place $x_{44}$ is absent for some reason.

column2: $x_1$ flirts with $x_2$ by doing $x_3$
$x_1$ is excited/feels excitement about $x_2$ (event/property); $x_2$ excites $x_1$

$x_1$ awaits for $x_2$ (event) with bated breath; $x_1$ waits for the occurrence of $x_2$ excitedly/restlessly; colloquially: $x_1$ just cannot wait for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ is eager for event $x_2$.
column3: The colloquial definition is figurative: the waiting must and will be performed, but $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to happen as soon as possible/to just come already- for time to flow faster. This is how a child feels on Christmas Eve night for Christmas Day. Usually positive; the negative version is essentially "dread". There should be a sense of longing (but future-oriented), intensity, and/or aching for what $x_1$ vaguely expects to happen (independent of what actually does end up happening). See also: {fizbu} (which lacks the sense of waiting), {denpa} (which lacks the sense of excitement and which has too many terbri). Proposed rafsi: "-fiz-".

column2: $x_1$ is (a) philosophy/ideology (one sense) about/of/pertaining to topic/subfield (one sense) $x_2$ with subfield (different sense)/features/details/specifics/specific idea(s) $x_3$, with methodology $x_4$, followed/thought/considered by $x_5$ (thinker/philosopher/individual); philosophy $x_1$ is characterized by values/thoughts/opinions/ruminations $x_3$ about topic/subject $x_2$.
column3: May also include code of conduct, ethical protocol, mode of thought, life-musings, etc.. x5 need not be an ardent supporter of the philosophy, although a certain degree of substance might be implied by the connection of being a philosophy (rather than a passing thought or idea) thereof; x5 does not need to be professional. Proposed short rafsi: -les-. See also: {pijyske}, {filsofiia}, {filsofo}, {marde}, {lijda}, {saske}, {jinvi}, {sidbo}, {pensi}, {prije}, {djuno}, {krici}, {menli}, {jijnu}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Filipino culture/nationality/language/geography in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a galaxy, of contents $x_2$ and other characteristics/parameters $x_3$; $x_1$ is galactic.
*$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column3: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column3: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column3: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

column2: $x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column3: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
column3: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

column2: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
column3: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
column3: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

column2: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
column3: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column2: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$
column3: Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and 心 (romaji: kokoro).

column2: $x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$
column3: This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.

column2: $x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition)
$x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
column3: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

column2: $x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development
$x_1$ is a microörganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
column3: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

column2: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
column3: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

column2: (moved to "{matxe}") $x_1$
$x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
column3: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

column2: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
column3: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

column2: $x_1$ is a dialect of language $x_2$
$s_1$ is sociolinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_1$ is a dialect of language $x_2$
$x_1$ is a language with dialects $x_2$ (full set)
column3: A narrower term than {bangu}, doesn't denote dialects. See also {bankle}

column2: $s_1$ is psycholinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$s_1$ is pragmatics based on methodology $s_2$.
column3: The science of how language interacts with the world. Cf. {banjikske}, {banmenske}.

column2: $s1$ pertains to language of $s2$=$b2$
column3: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for languages: From gismu {bangu} and {srana}

column2: $p_1$ is a linguist (scientist).

$s_1$ (phone/speech sounds; specifically is linguistic and vocal) is a phoneme in/of segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2$=$v_1$ in language $b_1$ of speaker $v_2$=$b_2$ in order to communicate/express $b_3$ (si'o/du'u; not quote(?)), produced with body-parts/tools $x_6$ at loci/in position/manner (of articulation) $x_7$
column3: Must be vocal. x2 is a recognized/represented by (belongs to equivalence class of) phoneme x1. Contrast with: {bancocysle} (which is nonvocal). Recognition of a phoneme as linguistically distinct is language-dependent; b1 is a language which includes/recognizes said phoneme (and which realizes/recognizes/categorizes/divides phones s2 into the equivalence class of that phoneme). x6 and x7 are not predictable from the veljvo.

column2: $x_1$ is a phonotactic rule pertaining to/organizing sound(s) $x_2$ into $x_3$ in/pertaining to language $x_4$ proposed/applied by $x_5$
$x_1$ is a code-switched mixture of languages $x_2$, used by $x_3$
$z_1$ grows $b_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$ to size/form $b_2$ from $b_3$.
$s_1$ is a nursery where $b_1$ grows to size/form $b_2$ from $b_3$.
$p_1$ pays bribe $p_2$ to $p_3$ for favor/services $p_4$=$b_2$.
column3: Not necessarily with a negative connotation.

column2: $b_2$=$s_1$ is a slave to $b_1$=$s_2$ in manner/service $s_3$.
$x_1$ exports $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ via $x_5$.
$f_1$ is inside-out, with part(s) $b_1$ currently on the outside.
$b_1$=$f_1$ falls outside of $b_2$ from (inside of) $f_3$
$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$ flowing out of $x_3$.

$x_1$ (observer/perceiver) senses external stimulus $x_2$ via means $x_3$ (sense/sensor) under conditions $x_4$; $x_3$ is a sense organ/exteroperceptor used to observe $x_2$ which is outside the observer $x_1$ under conditions $x_4$.
$g_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$.
$j_1$ is a bar/café manager/owner of bar/café $j_2$=$b_1$.
$s_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$=$s_2$.
$x_1$ is an exit/outlet/way out of $x_2$ for $x_3$.
$l_1$=$b_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles allowing the clear sight of $l_2$ (light) by $k_2$ (wearer).
$x_1$=$k_1$ exits/goes out/outside from $x_2$=$k_3$=$b_1$ with route $x_3$=$k_4$ with transportation method $x_5$.
column3: Omitted: x5 = klama2 (destination) = bartu1 (something external).  Cf. {bartu}, {klama}, {zevykla}, {barli'a}.

column2: $g_1$ ejects $k_1$ from $b_2$=$k_3$ via $k_4$ using means $k_5$.
$x_1$ projects/extends out of $x_2$.
$x_1$=$c_1$ leaves/exits/goes outside of $x_2$=$c_2$=$b_2$ via route $x_3$=$c_3$.
$c_1$ is an exonym of/for $c_2$, used/given by $c_3$.
column3: An exonym is a name externally given to something or someone, especially a place, ethnic group or language. It is the opposite of an endonym, a self-given or internal name ({sezme'e} or {nerme'e}). For instance, "美国" is an exonym for the U.S.A., and "Navajo" is an exonym for the Diné people.

column2: $x_1$ is a sense organ used to observe $x_2$ which is outside the observer $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a replacement-dialect replacing words $x_2$ (sequence) with words $x_3$ (sequence) in language $x_4$
$x_1$ uses $x_2$ (zo quote) as a replacement for $x_3$ (zo quote) in language $x_4$
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a pseudonym of $c_2$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$x_1$ vicariously experiences $x_2$ (ka/nu/li'i), imagining themself in place of $x_3$
$g_1$ (agent) replaces/substitutes $b_1$ for/instead of $b_2$ in circumstance $b_3$.
$x_1$ (plurality/set) replace/trade places with one another in circumstance $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {basti}, {simxu}. Similar in meaning to {simbasti}, but merges $basti_1$ and $basti_2$ together.

column2: $v_1$=$b_1$ is an anaphora/pronoun/pro-word in language $v_2$ replacing word $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_1$=$f_1$ is an act/event of replacement, with $x_2$=$b_1$ replacing/substituting for $x_3$=$b_2$.
$b_1$=$f_1$ (agent) bites apart $b_2$=$f_2$ into sections/partitions $f_3$ with bite locus $b_3$.
$x_1$=$b_1$=$k_1$ takes bite $x_2$=$b_3$=$k_2$ out of $x_3$=$b_2$=$k_3$ using teeth/implement $x_4$=$b_4$=$k_4$
$c_1$ writes $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with keyboard $c_4$.
$x1$=$b2$=$f1$ is a keyboard for purpose $x2$=$b3$ of material $x3$=$b4$
$b_1$=$u_1$ is a button in user interface $b_2$=$u_2$ with purpose $b_3$.
$m_1$=$b_1$ is chewing gum of type/composition $m_2$ in shape/form $m_3$.
$c_1$ is the basis of language $c_2$=$b_1$ used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$c_1$ is a language expert of language $c_2$=$b_1$.
$k_1$ is a language type/category/subgroup/subset (linguistic taxon) within languages $b_1$=$k_2$, with typological features $k_3$.
$x_1$ uses language $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$.
$d_1$=$b_1$ whines/bitches about $d_2$ by uttering $b_2$.
$n_1$=$b_2$ is a spoken/uttered message about subject $n_2$ uttered by $n_3$=$b_1$ to intended audience $n_4$.
$x_1$ (sound) is phonemically distinguished from $x_2$ (sound) in language $x_3$
$t_1$ is $b_1$'s pronunciation of utterance $b_2$ under conditions $t_3$.
$s_1$=$b_2$ is a phoneme/most basic phonological subunit of word, meaning/causing $v_2$ in language $v_3$.
$s_1$ is linguistics based on methodology $s_2$.
$s_1$=$b_1$ (agent) says $s_2$=$b_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $s_3$ through expressive medium $s_4$.
column3: Unlike {cusku}, which can refer to other forms of expression, ba'usku refers only to talking. Cf. {tavla}.

column2: $s_1$ (phone/speech sounds) is a segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2$=$b_2$.
$x_1$ is the meaning of linguistic expression $x_2$ in language $x_3$ according to interpreter $x_4$
$s_1$ is a split piece of language $b_1$=$s_2$.
$d_1$ desires/wants/wishes for future $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$ with desired future point $b_1$. $d_1$ aspires.
column3: b1 refers to the point in time when the aspiring individual wants the desire to come true; not the time they expect it to come true.

column2: $g_1$=$p_1$ thinks about/considers/ponders/reflects upon doing $b_1$=$g_2$=$p_2$ (nu) after $b_2$ (nu)
column3: I found that there was no good, single word for "thinking about doing ... after ...". (See {balvi}, {gasnu}, and {pensi})

column2: $x_1$ predicts that $x_2$ (du'u) is true in/about future time/place $x_3$ on grounds $x_4$.
column3: From {balvi} {jinvi}. Nearly synonymous with {la'erji'i}, {bavykri}. Related words: {kanpe}, {bavyxusra}, {bavyske}, {cfabalvi}, {tembalvi}, {selbalvi}, {ba'alvi}, {datru}, {temci}, {purci}, {cabna}, {uenai}, {ba'a}, {ba}.

column2: $b_1$=$l_1$ is next after $b_2$=$l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the next month; $m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the month following $b_2$=$l_2$, month standard $m_3$.
$c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow morning; $c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the morning after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $c_3$.
$n_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the night after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $n_3$.
column3: {cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. Cf. {nicte}, {prulamcte}, {bavlamdei}.

column2: $d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is tomorrow; $d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the day following $b_2$=$l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$j_1$=$b_1$ is the week directly after $b_2$ by standard $j_3$.
$x_1$ is the next/following time that $x_2$ happens.
$n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is next year; $n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the year following $b_2$=$l_2$ by year standard $n_3$.
$v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow evening; $v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the evening after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $v_3$.
$k_1$ is unable to/incapable of remembering future $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$. $k_1$ has anterograde amnesia/memory loss.
column3: Second place describes scope of loss. Cf. {mojnalka'e} {prumojnalka'e}

column2: $x_1$ is/are the latest, most forward in time among $x_2$
$x_1$ is futureward/to the futureward side/in the future of $x_2$ in frame of reference/according to observer or vantage point $x_3$.
column3: $x_1$ and $x_2$ probably should always be events ("{nu}"). This word is close to equivalent to "{balvi}"; a reasonable proposal would be to combine the two words, in analogy with spacial direction brivla; many, if not all, of the available glosses of one probably are shared with the other; minor connotational differences may exist. It means "more recent/more recent side (of event)" if $x_1$ is in the past. In a conceptual universe in which time is not oriented or in which there are multiple time dimensions, or perhaps if time is behaving exotically (such as with time-travel), $x_3$ can also be a "which faces" sumti slot, as in "{zunle}".
column5: after;forward in time;futureward;in the future of;more recent;to the future;toward the future

column2: $f_1$ ages / passes through time into future form $f_2 = b_1$ from current / past / earlier form $f_3 = b_2$ through stages $f_4$.
$x_1$ expects/anticipates $x_2$ to happen.
$p_1$ delays $p_2$ until after $b_2$.
$x_1$ is the future self/identity of $x_2$; $x_1$ is $x_2$ in the future.
column3: From {balvi} {sevzi}. $x_2$ is usually a person. Compare {cabyse'i}, {pruse'i}.

column2: $s_1$ is futurology/future studies of/about ideas of the future $b_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
column3: Science about the future, not to be confused with science in the future.

column2: $s_1$ is the fiancé(e)/betrothed of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.
$x_1$ asserts/prophesies that $x_2$=$b_1$ is true about the future of $b_2$.
column3: Compare to {bavji'i}, {bavykri}, which both deal with thought predictions rather than predictions in speech/writing.

column2: $x_1$=$s_1$ is a bank clerk of a bank $x_2$=$b_1$=$s_2$ owned by/in banking system $x_3$=$b_2$ for banking function(s) $x_4$=$b_3$ (event).
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a debit/bank/check card with balance $x_2$=$j_1$ at bank/financial institution $x_3$=$b_1$=$b_2$
column3: Necessarily coupled to bank account(s) with withdrawable (positive) balance. See payment card ({lejykarda}), credit/charge card ({jitseldejykarda}/{detseldejykarda}) and stored-value card ({vamveile'ikarda}). Cf. {maksriveikarda}, {lejykardymi'i}, {banxa}, {pleji}, {jdini}.

column2: time tense: forever after / forevermore
$x_1$ happens often enough during interval $x_2$ for $x_3$ to occur
$x_1$ is a necessary and sufficient condition for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1$ is a necessary and sufficient condition for $x_2$ to happen
column3: Synonymous with {bazyjvesa'u}. See also {banzu}, {sarcu}. Properties: bazysa'u(X,Y) ↔ bazysa'u(¬X,¬Y); bazysa'u(X,Y) ↔ [banzu(X,Y) ∧ sarcu(X,Y)]…

column2: $x_1$ is a daughter-in-law/son-in-law (a spouse of a child of) of $x_2$ according to law/custom $x_3$.
$g_1$ is giddy about $g_2$.
$b_1$=$z_1$=$p_1$ is a troll on $z_2$ with inflammatory message $z_3$.
column3: x2 is usually an internet bulletin board or newsgroup. Cf. {zunti}, {prenu}, {malzunpre}.

column2: $cr_1$=$cl_1$=$b_2$ is a crop top t-shirt / blouse of material $cr_2$.
column3: The lower portion is cut off, resulting in the exposure of some of the wearer's abdomen. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: efcrka. Cf. {creka}.
column5: belly shirt;crop top;cutoff shirt;half shirt;midriff shirt;short shirt;tummy top

column2: $x_1$ has a bellyache.
$k_1$=$b_2$ burps.
$k_1$ is the abdominal cavity of $k_2$.
$l_1$ is the waist of $b_2$
$p_1$ is the digestion of $p_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $b_2$.
$k_1$ is the navel of $k_2$.
$d_1$ is a belt of material $d_2$.
$t_1$ is the lower back [body-part] of $b_2$.
$be_1$=$ba_1$ is the navel / belly button (umbilicus) of $be_2$=$ba_2$.
column3: In humans, the navel can appear as a depression (kevna) or as a protrusion (punli). Cf. {befsfeke'a}, {betfu}, {barna}.

column2: $x_1$ ventriloquizes/ventriloquises $x_2$; $x_1$ is a ventriloquist
$s_1$ is the abdominal cavity of $b_2$
column3: Refers to the lower part of the ventral cavity in animals

column2: $be_1$=$ba_1$ is the Bengali language used by $ba_2$ to communicate $ba_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$r_1$ is measured in bangladeshi taka (৳) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Bangladesh monetary system $r_3$.
$b_1$=$g_1$ is Bangladesh.
$b_1$ is a cargo ship for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$x1$=$b1$=$c1$ is a stretcher carrying/hauling/bearing/transporting patient/dead $x2$=$b2$=$c3$ to $x3$=$b3$ from $x4$=$b4$ over path $x5$=$b5$
$p_1$=$b_1$ is a carrier/porter/waiter, carrying $b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$.
$c_1$ is a cart/carriage/wagon (wheeled vehicle) for carrying $c_2$=$b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$, propelled by $c_3$.
$j_1$ plays American/Canadian football against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$j_3$ is an American/Canadian football match/game with $j_1$ playing/competing against $j_2$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ is an American lion [Panthera leo atrox] of breed $c_2$.
column3: P. l. atrox, known as the American lion or American cave lion, was abundant in the Americas from Canada to Peru in the Pleistocene Epoch until about 10,000 years ago.

column2: $x_1$=$b_1$=$k_1$ is North America and South America;  $x_1$ is Pan-American; $x_1$ pertains to the Americas or reflects nationality/culture/geography thereof in property $x_2$=$b_2$=$k_2$.
$b_1$=$t_1$ is North America.
$c_1$ is a/the forebrain of brain $b_1$=$c_2$.
$p_1$ is an electroencephalogram of animal $b_2$ drawn by $p_3$ in medium $p_4$
$m_1$=$b_2$ is brain-dead.
$x_1$ is a meninx/mater of $x_2$.
$s_1$ is (cerebral) neurology/neuroscience with methodology $s_2$.
$s_1$ is the brainstem (truncus encephali) of brain $b_1$=$s_2$.
column3: The brain stem consists of pons and medulla.

column2: $t_1$ is a/the hindbrain (the posterior portion of the brain including cerebellum and pons and medulla oblongata) of  brain $b_1$=$t_2$.
$v_1$ is the braincase (part of cranium) of organism $b_2$.
$bo_1$=$v_1$ is a neurocranium/braincase/brainpan containing brain $bo_2$=$v_2$=$be_1$ of $bo_3$=$be_2$.
$x_1$ is a braincase/neurocranium hair.
$xa_1$ is a hemisphere of brain $b_1$=$xa_2$.
$x_1$ is a polar bear (Ursus maritimus) of type $x_2$
$z_1$=$c_1$ is a Barbary lion [Panthera leo leo] of breed $c_2$.
$d_1$ is a north-south-running road to $d_2$ from $d_3$ following primarily northward-and-southward path $d_4$ according to frame of reference $b_3$=$s_3$
$b_1$=$z_1$ is farther north than $b_2$=$z_1$ according to frame of reference $b_3$ by distance/gap/margin $z_4$.
$j_1$ is the latitude/declination of $j_2$ in system $j_3$.
$b_1$=$p_1$is the northern part of $b_2$=$p_2$.
$x_1$ is northwest of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is northeast of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is north by east of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$m_1$=$b_2$ is the mother of son $m_2$=$b_1$.
$g_1$ is a/the transportation industry/sector for $b_1$ transporting $b_2$ from $b_3$ to $b_4$.
$m_1$ is a truck/transporter/cart/sled/mode of transport for carrying $m_2$=$b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$, on surface medium $m_3$, propelled by $m_4$.
$b_1$=$g_1$ has a fever due to disease $b_3$.
$s_1$=$b_1$ is sickly/appears ill with symptoms $s_2$=$b_2$ from disease $b_3$ to observer $s_3$.
$bin_1$ develops illness $bin_2$=$bil_1$ with symptoms $bil_2$.
$l_1$ is pus of composition $l_2$ from disease $b_3$.

column3: Culturally important. This is the base for the so-called 'binary' prefixes ("kibi-", "mebi-", etc.). By switching to this base, "{ki'o}"/"{kilto}" might (in some Lojban dialects) refer to one thousand twenty-four (id est: 'kibi'); if we denote this number by "$b$" (for "binary" and "base"), then "ki'o"/"kilto" would (in those dialects) refer to $b^3 = (2^{(2*5/3)})^{3} = 2^{(2*5)} = 1024$ (in decimal notation); likewise for any other standard 'binary' prefix (ones which refer to a numeric coefficient of form $2^{(2*5n)}$ for nonzero integer $n$). In any case, "{bi'ei zei kilto}" would probably refer to such a value.

$x_1$ (text, image, page element) is supra/aforementioned/previous/earlier/preceding/above/toward the top of the page/screen (flat and primarily two-dimensional display) relative to $x_2$ (text, image, page element) on page/screen/in work $x_3$ according to cultural convention $x_4$.
column3: Because text is usually read horizontally, this word could mean "to the left of" (for left-to-right writing) or "to the right of" (for right-to-left writing), as assessed on each given line; additionally, any horizontal direction within the plane of the display can contribute a nonzero component, so long as $x_1$ is also topward of $x_2$. For texts/writing systems which begin at the bottom of a page (according to physical orientation), then this word refers to that direction instead of the physical top of the page. In other words, this word always is oriented back along the writing/display which, by cultural convention, the user should have already consumed. Can refer to distinct prior pages. Essentially, the entire document is imagined as being displayed upon a single, arbitrarily-long, ordered screen which is wide enough to display at most a single word/character or element per line throughout; in this configuration, $x_1$ precedes and is perforce 'above' $x_2$. See also: "{balvidzita}" (opposite), "{galprurci zei farna}".

column2: $x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$
column3: Especially in the face of difficulty; "keeping up the fight". The place structure is like {gunka} or {zukte}.

column2: $x_1$ is a kumquat of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$
column3: Especially in the face of difficulty; "keeping up the fight". The place structure is like {gunka} or {zukte}.

column2: unary mekso operator: Lorentz-Einstein gamma factor $+1/((1-(|X|^2))^{(+1/2)})$ for input $X$.
column3: Typically, input X can be a scalar (typically between -1 and 1, exclusive of both endpoints except in the limit) or a vector (or a similar mathematical object) with a signed magnitude belonging to the previously mentioned interval; in the former case, "|X|" in the definition refers to its absolute value; in the latter case, "|X|" in the definition refers to the nonnegative magnitude of said vector (or similar object). Typically, the output is a(n extended) real number no less than 1; whether or not positive-infinity exists in the codomain is a matter of convenience, convention, and context. This definition can be extended (such as for tachyons).

column2: digit/number: Euler–Mascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (γ); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).
column3: The difference in the limit as n becomes arbitrarily large between/of: the sum of (1/k) for all strictly positive integers k < (n+1), and the natural logarithm of n.

column2: abstractor: sensation / qualia abstractor; $x_1$ is the sensation / qualia associated with objects with property [bridi, bound to ce'u], via sense $x_2$, as sensed by $x_3$
column3: Semantically linked to {ganseti}. {lo} {ga'ei} ({ce'u}) {xunre} = {lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {xunre}. Is one proposed way of dealing with abstractions of colors ({zilska}) and other "elemental" sense experiences. Proposed rafsi: -gel-

column2:

{ga'i } - hauteur

{ga'i nai} - meekness

column3: Not necessarily causal; may be hypothetical.

column2:

column2: $x_1$ is a kumquat of species/variety $x_2$.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal conditional/only if (with gi).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).

mekso (no-more-than-4-ary) operator: Gaussian function $f(x, a, b, c) = c e^{-((x-a)^2 / (2*b^2))}$.
column3: Parameter 'a' is the SECOND operand; x is the first. Defaults: $c = 1/ \sqrt{2 \pi \sigma}$ (normalized), $a = \mu$ (the arithmetic average of the data set), $b = \sigma$ (the standard deviation of the data set). Moreover, by context, $\mu = 0$ (the average is 0) or $\sigma = 1$ (the standard deviation is 1) might be assumed by default.

column2: mekso n-ary operator: append contravariant (upper) indices to tensor
column3: Terminated by {te'oi'oi}. Takes ordered input (A, X_1, X_2, …, X_(n-1)), where A is a tensor and X_i is an index with an understood (or elsewhere defined) ordered domain. It appends/assigns X_i to be the ith contravariant index of A, which is usually designated as a superscript in the ith position to the right of A. See also: {ni'a'au}. It is probable that Einstein summation notation will be conventionally in effect.

$x_1$ is pickle-/cucumber-shaped
column3: Should be three-dimensional and enclose a volume. The shape is approximately cylindrical: there is an approximately linear, non-closed axis and any cross-section that is perpendicular thereto should be approximately circular (or trivial). The ends should be  rounded and can be tapered; the should not be sharp. The shape is fairly smooth. If the axis is linear, the shape should be convex. The axis should, at most, form a shape like a parenthesis "("; there should not be multiple changes in the sign of curvature. The diameter of the perpendicular cross-section should be largest toward the middle of the axis; the length of the axis should be rather larger than this diametric length.

metasyntactic variable prenex
column3: Explicitly marks variables, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or brodV (must be converted into sumti using {me'ei}) as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns these variables from any previous assignment. e.g. (me'ei broda me'ei brode ko'a ko'e fo'a fo'e ge'ai). See {ge'ei}, {ce'ai}, {ke'au}, {zo'u}, {da'o}

column2: metasyntactic variable marker
column3: Explicitly marks the preceding variable, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or {broda} series as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns the variable from any previous assignment. May also be used for pronouns like {mi} or {do} or {dei}. This is useful to refer to {mi} as a 'first-person pronoun' rather than the actual speaker themself, for example, when giving the definition of {mi'o}: '{mi} {ge'ei} {jo'u} {do} {ge'ei}', makes it clear that the speaker doesn't literally mean the speaker and the listener, but are using {mi} and {do} metasyntactically. Similarly, one might define {mi} as '{lo} {cusku} {be} {dei} {ge'ei}'. See {ge'ai}, {da'o}

column2: mekso 7-ary operator: for input $(X_1 = z, X_2 = (a_i)_i, X_3 = (b_j)_j, X_4 = p, X_5 = q, X_6 = h_1, X_7 = h_2)$, this word/function outputs/yields $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} (((\prod_{i = 1}^{p} ($ne'o'o$(a_i,n,1,h_1)))/(\prod_{j = 1}^{q} ($ne'o'o$(b_j,n,1,h_2)))) z^n/(n!))$; by default, $X_6 = 1 = X_7$ unless explicitly specified otherwise.
column3: See "{ne'o'o}" (Pochhammer symbol); however, for the purposes of this definition and regardless of the definition(s) provided at "ne'o'o", here ne'e'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = \prod_{k = 0}^{Y_2 - 1} (Y_1 + (-1)^{(1 - Y_3)} Y_4 k)$ by local definition; ne'o'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = 1$ for all $Y_2 < 1$, regardless of the other inputs $Y_m$ (so long as they belong to the domain); by default, $Y_4 = 1$ unless explicitly defined otherwise. For the main definition: $z$ is a complex number, and $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are (pre)defined sequences (id est: functions with domains being exactly the set of exactly all positive integers) such that, for all positive integer indices $i$ and $j$ respectively, their terms/outputs are complex numbers; both $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are indexed starting at $1$; also, $p, q, h_1, h_2$ are positive integers; by default, $h_1 = 1 = h_2$ unless explicitly specified otherwise. $X_2$ and $X_3$ may require usage of "{mau'au}" and "{zai'ai}".

column2: $10^3$; thousands
mekso unary operator: converts a string of digits which includes {pi} to the same string of digits without {pi}; if {pi} is not present in the original/input string, the output is identical
column3: Probably can be generalized to handle {pi'e} and distinguish macro- from micro-digits. Notice that it produces a string of digits; the meaning of this string must be established by processing through JUhU or the like. The input must also be a string of digits (not a number). Useful for certain algorithms, such as an nth root algorithm.
column5: delete radix point from digit string

column2: pro-sumti: refers to the proposition that is the left-hand side complement of the current logical connection.
column3: Typically used in the right-hand side connectand for referring back to the content of the left-hand side connectand.

column2: pro-sumti: in the second half of a sumti forethought connective expression, refers to the first half.
column3: For example, in "ge X gi lo co'e be gibu", gibu refers to X. In case of nesting, the innermost connective is targeted, unless a subscript specifies otherwise: in "ge X gi tu'a ga Y gi gibu", gibu refers to Y. "gibu xi re" may be used to refer to the second-innermost referent, X. See {nu bu}.

See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.

$x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' ancestor of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.
column3: $x_2$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_1$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_1$; trivially, one may consider $x_1$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_1$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazyseldze}". This word allows familial peers as possibilities for $x_1$ and $x_2$, so this relationship is a subtype of {ginydze}.

column2: $x_1$ is the biological/full/genetic-familial/'blood' parent of $x_2$; $x_2$ is the biological offspring/direct and immediate genetic-familial descendant of $x_1$.
column3: Step-parents are excluded, as are most other forms of parenting/rearing/raising/mentoring. Genetic clones may be included.
column5: ancestor;biological offspring;biological parent;blood parent;descendant;full parent;genetic offspring;genetic parent;immediate ancestor;immediate descendant

column2: $x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' descendant of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.
column3: $x_1$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_2$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_2$; trivially, one may consider $x_2$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_2$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazdze}".

column2: $x_1$ is a genetic-familial/biological/'blood' sibling of $x_2$ by bond/tie/standard/shared genetic parent(s) $x_3$.
column3: Half-siblings are included; step-siblings are excluded.

column2: $s_1$ is a chemical base (adenine/thymine/guanine/cytosine) within gene $j_1$=$s_2$.
$x_1$ is a genetic/biological ancestor (or familial peer thereof) of $x_2$ by relationship/to degree $x_3$ through/along graph-geodesic within their shared biological family.
column3: There is a genetic/biological path of parent-child connections which connects $x_2$ to a familial peer of $x_1$ such that this said peer and $x_1$ are approximately of the same generation (such as siblings or cousins); $x_1$ must belong to the same genetic family as $x_2$ and the said peer. Very similar to "{rirny'utka}", except genetic/biological connection is implied every step along the way, and $x_1$ may actually be a familial peer of the same generation as the actual direct ancestor, rather than necessarily being that direct ancestor themself. Notice that any familial peer of $x_2$ is a potential substitute themself for $x_2$ in this definition, so a symmetry wrt the breadth of specification due to allowance of peers is indeed implied, but need be explicitly allowed by the definition in only one case. This word is broader than and includes {ginlazdze}; it allows for the possibility of horizontal gene transfer, artificial genetic manipulation, clonal relations, very large organisms (such as certain fungi and aspens) which appear to be multiple organisms, asexual reproduction, and possibly even tissue transplants (not all of which "{ginlazdze}" will include).

column2: $x_1$=$l_1$ is a compound word with the word $x_2$=$g_1$ appearing inside it, composed from the affixes $x_3$=$l_4$
column3: Used when the syllables of a word appear in a compound word, made up from affixes. See {kibromge}.

Right-scoping adverbial clause: encloses a bridi and turns it into an adverbial term; the antecedent (ke'a) of the enclosed bridi stands for the outer bridi {lo su'u no'a ku} (the bridi in which this fi'oi term appears), including all the other adverbial terms (tags...) within this bridi located on the right of this fi'oi term (rightward scope).
afterthought abstraction wrapper
column3: Accepts 'gi'ei LE NU', 'gi'ei NU' (elided LE defaults to {lo}), or 'gi'ei LOhOI'. Wraps the bridi before it within an abstraction. e.g. 'mi klama le zarci gi'ei-le-nu cabna lo nu do klama' = 'le nu mi klama le zarci cu cabna lo nu do klama'. Also see {xoi}, {jai'i}. Grammar note: The {gi'ei}-group acts like a specialized {vau}, grabbing a single bridi. If you are in a sub-bridi of the bridi you wish to convert, you need to close the sub-bridi with {vau}, or use {i'au} to return to the top bridi of the sentence.

column3: This is the transport phenomena sense of "flux": a density of flow, the maximal rate of flow of a subsramce or quantity ($x_2$) through a differential hypersurface. If the hypersurface $x_3$ is $n$-dimensional spatially and the dimensionality (units) of $x_2$ is $U$, then the dimensionality (units) of $x_1$ is $U$/(1 m$^{n}$ * s). Fairly similar to {nildenmi}. For the hypersurface integral of this quantity (with respect to the normal), use: {flaumji}. See also: {flecu}.
